question_text: How does a DNS cache improve network performance?
answer_options: By redirecting users to proxy servers
By encrypting DNS requests for security
By storing recently resolved domain names to avoid repeated lookups
By prioritizing root server queries over local servers
correct_answer: By storing recently resolved domain names to avoid repeated lookups
explanation: The DNS cache holds previously resolved queries so that repeat lookups can be served faster without needing to contact DNS servers again.
